org.daisy.pipeline.tts

Class TTSEngine

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.daisy.pipeline.tts.TTSEngine
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    MarklessTTSEngine, SimpleTTSEngine 

    public abstract class TTSEngine
extends Object
    Classes that inherit from TTSEngine are the ones that deal with adapting external TTS processors (e.g. eSpeak and SAPI) to the Pipeline interface, which is used notably by the TextToPcm threads in the conversion from SSML to mp3. TTSEngines are meant to be allocated for every new session so that the end user can change the TTSEngine's parameters between two Pipeline jobs. Most of the methods of TTSEngine must be thread-safe.

    • Method Detail

      • getProvider

        public TTSService getProvider()
        Returns:
        the service from which the TTSEngine has been allocated.

      • synthesize

        public abstract Collection<AudioBuffer> synthesize(String sentence,
                                                   net.sf.saxon.s9api.XdmNode xmlSentence,
                                                   Voice voice,
                                                   TTSRegistry.TTSResource threadResources,
                                                   List<TTSService.Mark> marks,
                                                   List<String> expectedMarks,
                                                   AudioBufferAllocator bufferAllocator,
                                                   boolean retry)
                                            throws TTSService.SynthesisException,
                                                   InterruptedException,
                                                   AudioBufferAllocator.MemoryException
        This method must be thread-safe. But @param threadResources is here to prevent the service from locking internal resources.
        Parameters:
        sentence - is the sentence to synthesize. It is the serialized result of the SSML conversion performed by the XSLT whose URL is returned by TTSService.getSSMLxslTransformerURL(), or null if that method returns null.
        xmlSentence - is the XML version of @param sentence. It should not be used unless one needs information that has been lost during the serialization process (e.g. marks or CSS)
        voice - is the voice the synthesizer must use. It is guaranteed to be one of those returned by getAvailableVoices(). This parameter can't be null.
        threadResources - is the object returned by allocateThreadResource(). It may contain small persistent buffers, opened file streams, TCP connections and so on. The boolean field 'released' is guaranteed to be false, i.e. the resource provided is always valid and will remain so during the call.
        marks - are the returned pairs (markName, offset-in-output) corresponding to the ssml:marks of @param sentence. The order must be kept. The provided list is always empty. The offset-in-outputs are relative to the new buffers returned by synthesize(). That is, they start at 0. If the service doesn't handle SSML marks (i.e. endingmark() returns null). This parameter may be set to null.
        expectedMarks - are the mark names extracted from @param xmlSentence. The TTS engine can use them if it doesn't play well with complicated/long mark names, but it will harder to detect errors. It does include the TTS provider's ending mark. The ending-mark can be set to anything if the TTS processor or @param voice cannot handle marks.
        bufferAllocator - is the object that the TTS Service must use to allocate new audio buffers.
        retry - is true when this is not the first time the thread attempts to synthesize @param sentence. In such cases, you may reinitialize the connection to remote TTS servers if there are any.
        Returns:
        a list of adjacent PCM chunks produced by the TTS processor.
        Throws:
        TTSService.SynthesisException
        InterruptedException
        AudioBufferAllocator.MemoryException

      • getAudioOutputFormat

        public abstract AudioFormat getAudioOutputFormat()
        Returns:
        the audio format (sample rate etc.) of the data produced by synthesize(). The engine is assumed to use the same audio format every time. It is okay to return null before the first call to synthesize(), though it is better to return non-null values for optimization purposes. It must, however, return a non-null value once synthesize() has been called. Must be thread-safe.

      • getAvailableVoices

        public abstract Collection<Voice> getAvailableVoices()
                                              throws TTSService.SynthesisException,
                                                     InterruptedException
        Need not be thread-safe. This method is called from the main thread.
        Throws:
        TTSService.SynthesisException
        InterruptedException

      • allocateThreadResources

        public TTSRegistry.TTSResource allocateThreadResources()
                                                throws TTSService.SynthesisException,
                                                       InterruptedException
        This method must be thread-safe. It allocates new resources (such as TCP connections) unique for each thread. Allocations can be made on-the-fly from different threads. It must not catch InterruptuedExceptions.
        Returns:
        the resources. Must not be null.
        Throws:
        TTSService.SynthesisException
        InterruptedException

      • releaseThreadResources

        public void releaseThreadResources(TTSRegistry.TTSResource resources)
                            throws TTSService.SynthesisException,
                                   InterruptedException
        This method must be thread-safe. Deallocations may be performed from different threads but are always performed in the same thread as the one exploiting @param resources.
        Parameters:
        resources - is the object returned by allocateThreadResource()
        Throws:
        TTSService.SynthesisException
        InterruptedException

      • interruptCurrentWork

        public void interruptCurrentWork(TTSRegistry.TTSResource resource)
        Force interruption of the execution of synthesize() when the thread-level interruption is not enough to make synthesize() finish. Must be thread-safe, although the method must not wait for locks.
        Parameters:
        resource - is the same as the one provided to synthesize()

      • getOverallPriority

        public int getOverallPriority()
        Need not be thread-safe. This method is called from the main thread.

      • reservedThreadNum

        public int reservedThreadNum()
        Returns:
        the number of text-to-pcm threads reserved for this TTS processor. Different values than zero make only sense if the TTS speed is limited by the number of opened resources rather than by the number of cores. In such cases, we want to maximize the time spent on using the TTS resources by avoiding using threads for something else (e.g. audio encoding or calling other TTS processors).

      • expectedMillisecPerWord

        public int expectedMillisecPerWord()
        Returns:
        the average number of milliseconds the TTS processors is expected to spend to process a single word on a single CPU core. It doesn't need to be accurate. It is used for tuning the timeouts.

      • endingMark

        public String endingMark()
        Returns:
        the name of the mark that will be added to check whether all the SSML have been successfully synthesized. TTS processors that cannot handle marks must return null. Must be thread-safe.
